title: Further reduce virtual joystick movement sensitivity and add an in-game sensitivity control

requirements.text: Further reduce the player jet movement sensitivity in response to virtual joystick input by adjusting the joystick-to-movement mapping so that full joystick deflection produces a noticeably slower movement speed and small deflections near center produce finer control.
acceptanceCriteria: Player movement speed at maximum joystick deflection is reduced compared to the current behavior (slower top speed).
Small joystick movements near center result in more precise/gradual player movement (less jumpy).
No changes break joystick neutral behavior (releasing the joystick stops movement promptly).

requirements.text: Add a user-adjustable joystick sensitivity control in the gameplay UI that lets the player tweak movement sensitivity without code changes, and persist the setting locally so it is retained on refresh.
acceptanceCriteria: A sensitivity control is available during gameplay (playing/paused states) and is labeled in English.
Changing the control updates movement sensitivity immediately (no reload required).
The chosen sensitivity value persists across page reloads using client-side storage (e.g., localStorage).
The default sensitivity value matches the newly tuned baseline from REQ-1.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose these components instead).
Do not modify the immutable auth/actor hook files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Do not add backend persistence or any Motoko changes for sensitivity settings.
Do not add new gameplay mechanics unrelated to joystick sensitivity.
